reviews.review_msg: hard marker,  Don't waste your money by taking his class!

One of the best prof's I had at SFU. Sad to see he only taught for a couple years at SFU. Inspirational teacher, tough marker who expected a lot from his students. I wish I had a chance to take another course with him. Brought Geography alive.
Hard marker when grading the papers we submit in class.  The 80% attained in the group project saved me from otherwise getting a lower mark in the course overall.

Very passionate and interesting, hardly notice the 2 hours going by in lecture! Makes sure to connect with every student. Inspires different ways of thinking. Expects you to stay right on top of the reading and to be engaged with what you're learning, and there is a lot of work, but if you try you will succeed!
This course is not a good choice for an elective course. Take geo 111 instead. It is true that you have to write 2 essays which are 3 pages-single spaced each in 2 hours during the final :(

After reading these comments, I thought he is a good prof. But! He is from hell. In this 100 level course, not even a writing one, you are expected to write 4 essays and one group project with oral presentation. Moreover, you have to write 2 essays during 2 hours in the final. Maybe he does not know he is teaching a 100 course. WTF

Such a passionate professor! Lots of material and readings, but the lectures are very interesting. He runs his own tutorials, so you have more of a relationship with him. There were 3 small papers, a midterm and final. Tests are fairly hard, need to memorize names of people he refers to and what they're important for. Take his class!
Nice Teacher, runs tutorials, easy essays and marking, tests are a bit tough, interesting lectures
Great professor, very clear, very interesting lectures, and will always offer help. Attendance is mandatory, and exams are a bit much, but if they is a class with Akin, then take it.

Very passionate prof. Pop culture references keeps the class interesting. Lectures are a must. Previous ratings are true, he is very much dedicated to his students. Fair marker, if you review his comments on papers and try to improve, your mark will also improve. Definitely made me see the world differently. His exams are very long though.
Akin is the most dedicated professor. He makes a personal connection with every student and is clearly passionate about what he does. He's great!

Unbelievably passionate about geography !!! I've never met a prof so in love with geography and educating his students :)! The guy literally stays up at night wondering how he can further help struggling students in his class. Work hard and he recognizes it. A+++!
Excellent Pro. Interesting Class. 100% worth your tuition! :)
